data.nodeTypeDescription: This is the Root Node, from which the rest of the graph is built.
data.label: Root Node

data.nodeTypeDescription: This is the starting point for your bot's Behavior Tree logic.
data.label: Top Level Sequence Node

data.displayDescription: Action nodes represent complex actions (e.g., 'open the door').
data.label: Set charType
data.prompt: Store my bot's characterType in the data map. If characterType is not defined then fail.

data.displayDescription: Selector nodes execute children in order until one of them returns Success or all children return Failure. This is like an OR operator.
data.label: Choose an action

data.displayDescription: Sequence nodes execute children in order until one child returns Failure or all children returns Success. This is like an AND operator.
data.label: Floor switches

data.displayDescription: Condition nodes represent simple checks (e.g., 'is the gripper open?')
data.label: Is floor switch in range?
data.prompt: Find the closest floor switch. If it's not on then store it

data.displayDescription: Action nodes represent complex actions (e.g., 'open the door').
data.label: Stand on switch
data.prompt: Go stand on the stored "FloorSwitch". If I'm already standing on it then return Running.

data.displayDescription: Sequence nodes execute children in order until one child returns Failure or all children returns Success. This is like an AND operator.
data.label: Support human

data.displayDescription: Condition nodes represent simple checks (e.g., 'is the gripper open?')
data.label: Is human nearby?
data.prompt: Find the closest human. If they're more than 50 square meters away then store a reference to them

data.displayDescription: Action nodes represent complex actions (e.g., 'open the door').
data.label: Follow human

data.displayDescription: Sequence nodes execute children in order until one child returns Failure or all children returns Success. This is like an AND operator.
data.label: Attack enemy

data.displayDescription: Condition nodes represent simple checks (e.g., 'is the gripper open?')
data.label: Is enemy nearby?
data.prompt: Find the closest entity that isn't broken (null or false) on team 1 and store a reference to it

data.displayDescription: Action nodes represent complex actions (e.g., 'open the door').
data.label: Attack

data.displayDescription: Condition nodes represent simple checks (e.g., 'is the gripper open?')
data.label: Is in game?
data.prompt: If I'm not on the BossRoom scene or my bot is not defined then Running else succeed

data.displayDescription: Condition nodes represent simple checks (e.g., 'is the gripper open?')
data.label: Complete queued actions
data.prompt: If I have queued actions then return running
